website_summaries.verdict: With a beautiful design, excellent performance and battery life and a great display, the Lenovo Yoga 910 is one head-turning hybrid.
pros: The Lenovo Yoga 910 premium convertible has a gorgeous display that spans nearly the entire lid and delivers solid performance and long battery life for the category
It's a really cool looking laptop, too
cons: The right-hand Shift key is poorly placed and sized
Webcam is at the bottom of the screen
No direct video output or SD card slot
Separate USB Type-C ports for power and video-out kill the option for a single connection all-in-one dock

customer_reviews.title: Worst Key Board Set Up EVER
customer_reviews.text: There is a "standard" keyboard design for a reason. Whoever designed this keyboard should be terminated. Whoever approved this keyboard should be terminated. Where the right "shift" key should be, they put the up arrow. Doesn't seem like a big deal, but if you can keyboard without looking at the keyboard, you are constantly moving your curser up in whatever you are working on, versus getting a capital letter. It is maddening. This otherwise perfect laptop is ruined by this seemingly simple alteration. Again, there is a standard keyboard design for a reason. If this laptop weren't so expensive, I would have bashed it with a hammer.
customer_reviews.author: D. Haight

customer_reviews.title: Good computer bad keyboard lay out
customer_reviews.text: Love the computer hate the placement of the right hand shift key. Where the shift key should be they put an up arrow. I have locked myself out of accounts because I keep hitting up arrow instead of shift key. I have sort of gotten use to it, but when I use other computers and then come back to this one same learning curve all over. Why would they move the shift key like that. Bad keyboard design.
customer_reviews.author: Randy

customer_reviews.title: Hidden gem
customer_reviews.text: I tried the Dell XPS 13 and HP Spectrum and both had issues. This Yoga is about as close to perfect as you can get. Very fast and outstanding battery life. The quality is unmatched and for the money this is a hidden gem. I see the Lenovo brand was just rated number one for 2017 and this computer is one of the reasons why.
customer_reviews.author: jeff mcclellan

customer_reviews.title: I really like the light weight of this computer and the fast ...
customer_reviews.text: I really like the light weight of this computer and the fast speed it has. It does tend to slow down and freeze up 2 months after using however I installed a clean up program that helps it run smooth and it seemed to eliminate the freezing up for now.
customer_reviews.author: shemae

customer_reviews.title: The appearance of this PC looks great. I especially like its folded design so I ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this PC three months ago. The appearance of this PC looks great. I especially like its folded design so I can watch movies on airplane. However, there is a hardware defect on its keyboard. Specifically, WER and UIO keys work intermittently. Can Lenovo has a little better quality control on their production line? Yes, I can use these keys under tablet mode, but it is annoying if I want to type a long document.
customer_reviews.author: JC Dong

customer_reviews.title: the laptop is ok. However, nobody is telling ...
customer_reviews.text: the laptop is ok. However, nobody is telling you that the stylus capable screen is not active so you cannot use a pen or microsoft ink workspace.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Exactly as described
customer_reviews.text: I gave this computer as a gift to my father and Has been very efficient, very thin, light weighted, the battery lasts a lot. No complains about it
customer_reviews.author: Victor Herrera

customer_reviews.title: here is a boot problem with this device that I've since learned is common to Lenovo devices.
customer_reviews.text: There is a boot problem with this device that I've since learned is common to Lenovo devices.
customer_reviews.author: Suz Cura

customer_reviews.title: ... and Yoga 2 and this Yoga 910 is the best ultrabook ever
customer_reviews.text: I owned Yoga 1 and Yoga 2 and this Yoga 910 is the best ultrabook ever. Just perfect, very fast response, AAA screen, after 1 years this Yoga 910 stay +5 hours with battery, and weiths 3 pounds. The fan noise doesn't bother me.
customer_reviews.author: Cesar Andrade

customer_reviews.title: Bad product
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointing - there were hardware problems, on account of which it would not function at all. Had to return it. Bought another one from Best Buy, but is giving trouble as well - frequently freezes, and has to be restarted. This is very disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: Toufiq Ali

customer_reviews.title: Yes, Yoga!  Windows 10, meh.
customer_reviews.text: This is the first lap top I've used in a while. It works well even though I am not fond of Windows 10. I'd recommend it to friends that want a lap top, especially if they'd prefer a desktop that isn't intuitive and looks like a smart phone. The Yoga itself is terrific and the screen quality is excellent!
customer_reviews.author: Laffs-NTX

customer_reviews.title: It took me an hour to conclude that the beautiful looking machine had a hardware malfunction
customer_reviews.text: Within twenty minutes of starting up my new Lenovo Yoga 910, I discovered that the space bar and the backspace keys did not function. It took me an hour to conclude that the beautiful looking machine had a hardware malfunction. Lenovo support confirmed my conclusion and offered to repair the machine, since it was still under warranty. I said I would have to be insane to go that route. I returned the Yoga 910 to Amazon and ordered an Asus Zen Book, which I hope does not arrive broken.
customer_reviews.author: George Stanciu

customer_reviews.title: Terrible fan noise and right shift key
customer_reviews.text: Terrible fan noise and right shift key. The tiny right shift key, bizarrely put to the right of the keyboard up arrow, makes typing quickly on this laptop impossible. This is only fit for web browsing, not work.
customer_reviews.author: TM

product_meta.title: Lenovo Yoga 910 80VF002JUS 13.9-Inches laptop (7th Gen i7-7500U, 8GB, 256GB SSD, Windows 10 Home), Silver
product_meta.description: The Yoga 910 is a sleek and powerful laptop that makes a stylish statement about how you work and play. Its all metal unibody design and ultrathin bezel catches the eye while its fast performance high definition 4K display and immersive sound inspire your imagination. More than just a laptop the Yoga 910 understands your lifestyle.
feature_bullets: 7th Gen Intel Core i7-7500U mobile processor; 8 GB memory; 256 GB Solid State Drive
14" Full HD 10-point multitouch screen; 360° flip-and-fold design; Intel HD Graphics 620; Silver
Weighs 3.09 lbs. and measures 0.6" thin; Ultraportable design, omitting the DVD/CD drive for compact form factor. 4-cell lithium-polymer battery

Backlit keyboard; Fingerprint reader; HD webcam with two microphones; WiFi 802.11 ac; Bluetooth 4.1; USB 3.0; USB Type-C; Headphone/microphone combo jack; 2 x JBL stereo speakers with Dolby Audio Premium
Windows 10 Home; 30-days trial of Microsoft Office 365

specifications.Customer Reviews: 3.3 out of 5 stars35 ratings3.3 out of 5 stars
